description: Part demolition of existing garage, front porch and side extension to no. 12 Adnams Walk, new side entrance door and windows to no. 12 Adnams Walk and erection of a two storey 3-bedroom detached dwelling with habitable roof and associated parking on the land adjacent to 12 Adnams Walk
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
Reason:-
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
Reason:-

The Local Planning Authority consider it essential that the whole of the development is carried out and that no departure whatsoever is made from the details approved, since the development would not necessarily be acceptable if partly carried out or carried out differently in any degree from the details submitted.

The proposed developments hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the materials detailed on the submitted and approved plans unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To ensure that the appearance of the proposed development will harmonise with the character of the surrounding area.

Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of all proposed walls, fences and boundary treatment shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The boundary development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained permanently thereafter to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:

Insufficient information has been supplied with the application to judge the appropriateness of any boundary treatment.  Submission of this detail prior to commencement will protect the visual amenities of the development and prevent undue overlooking of adjoining property.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, no extension or enlargement in relation to Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A shall be made to the new dwellinghouse(s) hereby permitted, or any detached building erected within the curtilage of the new dwellinghouse, without the express permission in writing of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:-
In the interests of amenity and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over future development.

The proposed first and second floor flank windows of the new dwelling shown on drawings  'AW:12:JAWS:P6' and 'AW:12:JAWS:P7 A' accompanying the application shall be permanently glazed with obscure glass not less than level 3 on the standard scale of obscurity and shall thereafter be maintained as such and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7m above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.
Reason:-
In the interests of privacy.

The proposed first and second floor flank windows to no. 12 Adnams Walk shown on drawings 'AW:12:JAWS:P6' and 'AW:12:JAWS:P7 A' accompanying the application shall be permanently glazed with obscure glass not less than level 3 on the standard scale of obscurity and shall thereafter be maintained as such and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7m above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.
Reason:-
In the interests of privacy.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, no window or other opening (other than those shown on the submitted and approved plan,) shall be formed in the flank wall(s) of the building(s) hereby permitted, unless specific permission under the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 has first been sought and obtained in writing from the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:-
In order to ensure a satisfactory development that will not result in any loss of privacy or damage to the environment of neighbouring properties which exist or may be proposed in the future.

No demolition or construction works, or deliveries, into the site shall take place other than between the hours of 08:00 to 18:00 on Monday to Friday and 08:00 to 13:00 hours on Saturdays unless agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. No demolition or construction works, or deliveries shall take place on Sundays, Bank or Public Holidays unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To protect residential amenity.
Building Regulations - All dwellings hereby approved shall be constructed to comply with Part M4(2) of the Building Regulations - Accessible and Adaptable Dwellings.
Reason: In order to comply with Policy 7 of the Havering Local Plan and Policy D7 of the London Plan.
Water efficiency - All dwellings hereby approved shall comply with Regulation 36 (2)(b) and Part G2 of the Building Regulations - Water Efficiency.
Reason: In order to comply with Policy SI 5 of the London Plan.

The development hereby approved shall be fitted with Ultra-Low NOx boilers with maximum NOx Emissions less than 40 mg/kWh. Where any installations do not meet this emissions standard it should not be operated without the fitting of suitable NOx abatement equipment or technology as determined by a specialist to ensure comparable emissions. The installation of the boilers shall be carried out in strict accordance with these details and shall thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: To minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality.

Prior to the first occupation of the proposed dwelling hereby approved, one of the residential parking space(s) proposed to the front of the new dwelling shall be provided with active vehicle charging facilities for electric or Ultra-Low Emission vehicles.

Reason: Provision prior to first occupation of the proposed dwellings hereby permitted will ensure that the development adequately incorporates measures to allow the use of electric vehicles by future occupiers in accordance with Policy T6.1 of the London Plan.

The hard surface hereby approved (including any sub-base) shall be made of porous materials or provision shall be made to direct run-off water from the hard surface to a permeable or porous area or surface within the curtilage of the dwellinghouse.
Reason:-
In order to ensure no water run-off from the hard surface which would contribute to risk of flooding

The proposal is liable for the Mayor of London Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL). The Mayoral CIL levy rate for Havering is 25/m² and is chargeable for each additional square metre of residential gross internal [floor] (GIA).  Based upon the information supplied with the application, £3,000 would be payable due to result in new properties with a combined gross internal floor area of 120m² of GIA, however this may be adjusted subject to indexation.

The proposal is also liable for Havering Council's CIL. Havering's CIL charging rate for residential is £125m² (Zone A for each additional square metre of GIA. Based upon the information supplied with the application, £15,00 would be payable, subject to indexation.

Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, permission is not given for a rear dormer to the donor property (12 Adnams Walk), which does not form part of this application, as specifically stated on the drawing 'AW:12:JAWS:P9B'.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent via email. The revisions involved amendments to the design of the rear dormer of the proposed dwelling as well as the car parking layout. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 26/02/2024.
